column4: hey, if i wanted to play games on a linux box, would it be better to use ubuntu or xubuntu
It wouldn't matter.
If your system is low of resources xfce might give you a bit of an advantage
remember that not all games run in ubuntu well / at all
: which linux works the best with games then?
They're all about the same. What games are you looking to play?
: Savage and warcraft 3
have a look at http://appdb.winehq.org and also their websites. They may run under ubuntu natively or you may need to emulate windows (thats what WINE does)
: doesnt work for both, gives same error, i want 6.10 to work
ext3?
wrong person, sorry
How did you get the CDs? Download and Burn?
: i dled the 6.10 from the ubuntu site
The Desktop CD or the Alternative CD?
When you load the 6.10 CD, do you get a prompt which says like "Just hit enter to install", or does it boot into an environment where you can use the mouse and click "Install"?
And does it boot fully, until you get to the state I just described?
: i get to a basic menu, u cant use a mouse, it asked to 1- start/install ubuntu 2- start the graphics in safe mode and i cant remeber the rest of the options
And when you go to Start/Install, what happens?
Okay. How did you download your .iso file, torrent or normally?
: normally
It could be one of three things. 1) The ISO you downloaded didn't get downloaded completely/properly. 2) The CD you burnt was a bad burn 3) Ubuntu genuinly can't handle your video setup
Please boot the CD, and on the initial menu, select "Check CD for defects", and press enter.
